improvement_list.improvement_desc: Division by zero error.  The variable 'x' will be 0 after the loop, leading to a runtime error when calculating y = (1 / x).

Unreachable code. The if condition (x > 0) will always be true inside the for loop because the loop continues as long as x is greater than 0, meaning the y = 0; statement inside the if block is always executed, making the rest of the for loop's body unreachable.
The variable 'x' is decremented in each iteration of the for loop until it reaches 0.  This can lead to an error when calculating 'y'.  Add input validation or a check to prevent this.
The calculation y = (1 / x) can be simplified to y = 0 when x is 0 after the loop. This avoids the runtime error and makes the code more robust.
